questions.text:
#### Q1. From what distribution does the `rand()` function return value?

- %OPTION% normal
- %OPTION% poisson
- %OPTION% binomial
- %OPTION% uniform

#### Q3. What does the Profiler track?

- %OPTION% execution time
- %OPTION% command history
- %OPTION% errors
- %OPTION% the value of variables

#### Q7. What is `%%` used for?

- %OPTION% argument placeholder
- %OPTION% block quotes
- %OPTION% code sections
- %OPTION% conversion specifier

#### Q8. what is the `.` character NOT used for?

- %OPTION% structure field access
- %OPTION% a decimal point
- %OPTION% cell array access
- %OPTION% element-wise operations

#### Q9. Which function could you use for multiple linear regression?

- %OPTION% polyval
- %OPTION% regress
- %OPTION% solve
- %OPTION% polyfit

#### Q10. For which of these arrays do `mean`, `median`, and `mode` return the same value?

- %OPTION% [0 1 1 1 2]
- %OPTION% [1 3 5 5 6]
- %OPTION% [0 1 1 1 1]
- %OPTION% [0 0 5 5 5]

#### Q11. You are in the middle of a long MATLAB session where you have performed many analyses and made many plots. You run the following commands, yet a figure window doesn't pop up on the top of your screen with your plot. What might be the issue?

```
x = [-1:0.1:1];
y = X.^2;
plot(x, y)
```

- %OPTION% Your plot doesn't plot in a figure window because `figure` was not called immediately in advance.
- %OPTION% Your `plot` syntax is incorrect.
- %OPTION% Your plot is in a figure window that was already open, hidden behind other windows on your screen.
- %OPTION% Your plot was saved to an image file but not displayed.

#### Q12. How do you access the value for the field `name` in structure S?

- %OPTION% S['name']
- %OPTION% S.name
- %OPTION% S('name')
- %OPTION% S{'name'}

#### Q13. What built-in definition does i have?

- %OPTION% basic imaginary unit
- %OPTION% index function
- %OPTION% infinity
- %OPTION% index variable

#### Q15. You have plotted values of cosine from -10 to 10 and want to change the x-axis tick marks to every pi, from -3*pi to 3*pi. Which statement will do that?

- %OPTION% xticks(-3*pi:3.14:3*pi)
- %OPTION% xticks(-3*pi:pi:3*pi)
- %OPTION% xticks(linespace(-3*pi(), 3*pi(), pi()))
- %OPTION% xticks(linespace(-3*pi, 3*pi, pi)

#### Q16. What is the value of `c`?

```
a = ones(1,3);
b = 1:3;
c = conv(a,b)
```

- %OPTION% [-1 2 -1]
- %OPTION% [1 3 6 5 3]
- %OPTION% 6
- %OPTION% [1 -2 1]

#### Q17. Which function CANNOT be used to randomly sample data?

- %OPTION% datasample
- %OPTION% randi
- %OPTION% resample
- %OPTION% randperm

#### Q18. Which choice is correct syntax for a `switch` statement?

- %OPTION% A

```
x = 7;
switch x
    case 2
        disp("two");
    otherwise
        disp("not two");
end
```

- %OPTION% B

```
x = 7;
switch x :
    case 2
        disp("two");
    otherwise
        disp("not two");
end
```

- %OPTION% C

```
x = 7;
switch x
    case 2
        disp("two");
    else
        disp("not two");
end
```

- %OPTION% D

```
x = 7;
switch x
    case 2
        disp("two");
    default
        disp("not two");
end
```

#### Q19. What is the result of this code?

```
a = 1;
b = 2;
c = 3;
d = 4;
e = c / (~a - b == c - d);
```

- %OPTION% Error
- %OPTION% B

```
c =
    NaN
```

- %OPTION% C

```
c =
    Inf
```

- %OPTION% D

```
c =
    -0.2500
```

#### Q20. What is true of a handle class object?

- %OPTION% When you pass a handle object to a function, a new object is made that is independent of the original.
- %OPTION% All copies of handle objects refer to the same underlying object.
- %OPTION% Handle object cannot reference one another.
- %OPTION% Handle object do not have a default `eq` function.

#### Q21. Which choice has a different final result in `f10` than the other three?

- %OPTION% A

```
f10 = 1;
for i = 1:10
    f10 = f10 * i;
end
```

- %OPTION% B
      `f10 = factorial(10)`
- %OPTION% C

```MATLAB
f10 = 1;
i = 1;
while i <= 10
    i   = i + 1;
    f10 = i * f10;
end
```

- %OPTION% D
      `f10 = prod(1:10)`

#### Q22. Which choice will NOT give you a 5 x 5 identity matrix?

- %OPTION% A

```
a = rand(5);
round(a * inv(a))
```

- %OPTION% B
      `diag(ones(5, 1))`
- %OPTION% C
      `identity(5)`
- %OPTION% D
      `eye(5)`

#### Q28. Which statement returns the roots for the polynomial `x^2 + 2x - 4`?

- %OPTION% poly([1 2 -4])
- %OPTION% solve(x^2 + 2x - 4 == 0)
- %OPTION% polyfit(x^2 + 2x - 4 == 0)
- %OPTION% roots([1 2 -4])

#### Q29. Which choice is the proper syntax to append a new elements `a` to the end of 1x 2 dimensional cell array `C`?

- %OPTION% C = {C a};
- %OPTION% C = cellcat(C a)
- %OPTION% C = cat(2, {a}, C)
- %OPTION% C{end+1}=a

#### Q33. Which statement is true about the sparse matrices?

- %OPTION% You can use the `sparse` function to remove empty cells from cell array variables.
- %OPTION% Sparse matrices always use less memory than their associated full matrices.
- %OPTION% Mixtures of sparse and full matrices can be combined in all of MATLAB's built-in arithmetic operations.
- %OPTION% The `sparse` function requires its input to be a full matrix with at least 50% zero elements.

#### Q34. Which statement using logical indices will result in an error?

`a = 1:10;`

- %OPTION% b = a(a ~= 11)
- %OPTION% b = a(a == 1)
- %OPTION% b = a(a>6 && a<9)
- %OPTION% b = a(a | 1)

#### Q35. Which statement turns `menu` into the variable `menu_string` below?

```
menu = {'hot dog' 'corn dog' 'regular burger' 'cheeseburger' 'veggie burger'}
menu_string =
    'hot dog
     corn dog
     regular burger
     cheeseburger
     veggie burger'
```

- %OPTION% menu_string = cell2mat(join(menu, newline))
- %OPTION% menu_string = cell2mat(join(menu, '\n'))
- %OPTION% menu_string = join(menu, newline)
- %OPTION% menu_string = cell2mat(pad(menu))

#### Q36. Which code snippet sets a new random seed based on the current time and saves the current settings of the random number generator?

- %OPTION% `rng_settings_curr = rng('shuffle');`
- %OPTION% B

```
rng(time());
rng_settings_curr = rng();
```

- %OPTION% C
      `rng_settings_curr = rand('shuffle');`
- %OPTION% D

```
rng('shuffle');
rng_settings_curr = rng();
```

#### Q37. You have a matrix `data` in which each column is mono audio recording from a room in your house. You've noticed that each column has a very different mean and when you plot them all on the same graph, the spread across the y axis make it impossible to see anything. You want to subtract the mean from each column. Which code block will accomplish this?

- %OPTION% `data_nomean = data - repmat(median(data), size(data, 1), 1);`
- %OPTION% `data_nomean = bsxfun(@minus, data, mean(data));`
- %OPTION% .

```
data_nomean = zeros(size(data));
for i = 1:size(data, 1)
    data_nomean(i, :) = data(i, :) - mean(data(i, :));
end
```

- %OPTION% .
      `data_nomean = zscore(data');`

#### Q39. Which statement creates a logical array that is 1 if the element in `passwords` contains a digit and 0 if it does not?

`passwords = {'abcd' '1234' 'qwerty' 'love1'};`

- %OPTION% contains(password, '\d')
- %OPTION% ~isempty(regexp(passwords, '\d'))
- %OPTION% cellfun(@(x) ~isempty(regexp(x, '\d')), passwords)
- %OPTION% regexp(passwords, '\d')

#### Q40. Which is NOT a function that adds text to a plot?

- %OPTION% title
- %OPTION% text
- %OPTION% label
- %OPTION% legend

#### Q41. Which code block most likely produced this graph?

![MatLab Q39](images/matlab_Q39.jpg)

- %OPTION%

```
figure
x = rand(10,10);
r = corrcoef(x);
surf(r)
colorbar
```

- %OPTION%

```
figure
x = rand(10,10);
r = corrcoef(x);
imagesc(r)
colorbar
```

#### Q42. What kind of files are stored with the .mat extension?

- %OPTION% figure files
- %OPTION% script files
- %OPTION% function files
- %OPTION% stored variable files

#### Q43. You would like to randomly reorder every element in array a and put the result into another array b. Which code is NOT necessary to do that?

`a = 1:10;`

- %OPTION% :
      `b = a(randi(10, 1, 10));`
- %OPTION% :

```
m = perms(a);
i = randi(factorial(10), 1);
b = a(m(i, :))
```

- %OPTION% :

```
[s, j] = sort(rand(10, 1));
b      = a(i);
```

- %OPTION% :

```
b = a(randperm(10));
```

#### Q44. Which statement returns **1** (true)?

```
a = 'stand'
b = "stand"
```

- %OPTION% a == b
- %OPTION% ischar(b)
- %OPTION% length(a) == length(b)
- %OPTION% class(a) == class(b)

#### Q46. Where in the UI can you see what variables have been created, their values, and their class?

- %OPTION% Editor
- %OPTION% command window
- %OPTION% details
- %OPTION% workspace

#### Q47. Given the following x and y coordinates, which choice calculates a linear regression for the x and y coordinates, and which plots the points of the x,y data and the regression line on the same graph?

```
x = 9.0646 6.4362 7.8266 8.3945 5.6135 4.8186 2.8862 10.9311 1.1908 3.2586
y = 15.4357 11.0923 14.1417 14.9506 8.7687 8.0416 5.1662 20.5005 1.0978
```

- %OPTION% :

```
coeff_line = polyfit(x,y,1)
x_line = floor(min(x)):0.1:ceil(max(x));
y_line = polyval(coeff_line,x_line)

figure; plot(x,y,'o')
hold on
plot(x_linemy_line)
```

- %OPTION% :

```
figure
plot(x,y,'o')

coeff_line = polyfit(x,y,1);
x_line = floor(min(x)):0.1:ceil(max(x));
y_line = polyval(coeff_line,x_line);
plot(x_line,y_line)
```

- %OPTION% :

```
figure
plot(x,y)

coeff_line = polyfit(x,y,1);
x_line = floor(min(x)):0.1:ceil(max(x));
y_line = polyval(coeff_line,x_line);
hold on; plot(x_line,y_line)
```

- %OPTION% :

```
coeff_line = polyfit(x,y,1);
x_line = floor(min(x)):0.1:ceil(max(x));
y_line = polyval(coeff_line,x_line);

figure; plot(x,y,'o')
hold on
plot(x_line,y_line)
```

#### Q48. If you run this piece of code, you will get an error. Why?

```
a = [0 1 2 3; 4 5 6 7];
a = a^2;
```

- %OPTION% You are attempting to multiply a non-square matrix by itself, causing a dimension mismatch.
- %OPTION% MATLAB does not allow you to square all the elements in the matrix in a single operation.
- %OPTION% You must use the \*\* operator instead of the ^ operator.
- %OPTION% You cannot square matrices that have a 0 as the first element.

#### Q49. Which command will create a 10-element vector v with values from 1 to 10?

- %OPTION% v = {1:10}
- %OPTION% v = [1-10]
- %OPTION% v = 1:10
- %OPTION% v = (10)

#### Q50. For a 5 x 5 array, the two subscript index (4,2) indexes the same location as linear index `___`.

- %OPTION% 7
- %OPTION% 8
- %OPTION% 17
- %OPTION% 9

#### Q51. What is a difference between global variable and persistent variables?

- %OPTION% Global variables have a higher performance overhead than persistent variables.
- %OPTION% Global variables remain in memory after clear all; persistent variables do not.
- %OPTION% Global variables can be used to cache data in memory; persistent variables cannot.
- %OPTION% Global variables are accessible outside the function scope; persistent variables are not.

#### Q52. How is the random seed for MATLAB's random number generator first initializedin a MATLAB Session?

- %OPTION% Seed is undefined until it is initialized by the user.
- %OPTION% Seed is set to a value based on the current time when user first calls rand()
- %OPTION% Seed is set to a value based on the current time on startup.
- %OPTION% Seed is set to a static default value on startup.

[Reference](https://ch.mathworks.com/help/matlab/math/why-do-random-numbers-repeat-after-startup.html)

#### Q53. At what will MATLAB look first for a called function?

- %OPTION% functions on the path
- %OPTION% built-in functions
- %OPTION% functions within the current file
- %OPTION% functions within the current directory

[Reference](https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/matlab_env/files-and-folders-that-matlab-accesses.html)

#### Q55. What is the state of a at the end of this code?

```
a = [1 2; 3 4];
b = a(:,2);
c = b + 3;
a(1:2,1) = c;
```

- %OPTION% :

```
a =
    6   3
    7   4
```

- %OPTION% :

```
a =
    5   2
    7   4
```

- %OPTION% :

```
a =
    5
    7
```

- %OPTION% :

```
a =
    6
    7
```

[Reference](https://mathworks.com/company/newsletters/articles/matrix-indexing-in-matlab.html)

#### Q56. You've just plotted some data and want to change the color behind the lines you've plotted to black. Which code block will accomplish this?

- %OPTION% `h_f = figure; set(h_f,'Color', [0 0 0]);`
- %OPTION% `h_a = gca; set(h_a,'Color', [0 0 0]);`
- %OPTION% `h_a = axes; set(h_a,'Color', [0 0 0]);`
- %OPTION% `h_f = gcf; set(h_a,'Color', [0 0 0]);`

#### Q57. Which statement will return all the odd numbers from 1 to 9?

- %OPTION% `2*[1:5]+1`
- %OPTION% `1:2:9`
- %OPTION% `isodd(1:9)`
- %OPTION% `1:odd:9`

#### Q58. In MATLAB, the `imfilter` command performs a convolution operation between an image and a matrix. Suppose you have an image loaded in MATLAB into the variable `img` and you apply the following code. The original image appears slightly blurred because the convolution smoothed out the image (removed noise). Why do you think this happened?

```
h = ones(5,5)/25;
imshow(imfilter(img,h));
```

- %OPTION% `h` is a Gaussian filter that adds to 1. Its intended effect is to highlight image edges.
- %OPTION% `h` is an averaging filter uniformly distributed that adds to 1. Its intended effect is to smooth out images (remove noise).
- %OPTION% `h` is a Laplacian filter that adds up to 0. Its intended effect is to smooth out images (remove noise).
- %OPTION% `imfilter` is a function that always blurs the images.

#### Q59. What is the size of `b`?

```
a = [1 2 3];
b = repmat(a,2,3);
```

- %OPTION% 1x3
- %OPTION% 3x2
- %OPTION% 2x3
- %OPTION% 2x9

#### Q60. Which statement reverses vector `a`?

```
a = [ 1 2 3 4];
```

- %OPTION% reverse(a)
- %OPTION% a(end:- 1:1)
- %OPTION% rev(a)
- %OPTION% a(::-1)

#### Q61. Which command will create a column vector with the values 7, 8, and 9?

- %OPTION% `c = [7,8,9]`
- %OPTION% `c = [7: 8: 9]`
- %OPTION% `c = [7; 8; 9]`
- %OPTION% `c = [7 8 9]`

#### Q62. What do you call in the **command** window to see all the variables in the workspace and their classes?

- %OPTION% `who`
- %OPTION% `vars`
- %OPTION% `whos`
- %OPTION% `who all`

#### Q63. You wrote a new function named `snap` in an m-file and when you call it, you're not getting the output you expect. You previously wrote a different function named `snap`, which you think might also be on the search path. Which command can you use to see if the old `snap` function is being called?

- %OPTION% which
- %OPTION% who
- %OPTION% lookfor
- %OPTION% what

#### Q64. What is a reason to save a MAT-file using the `-v7.3` flag?

- %OPTION% to ensure backward compatibility
- %OPTION% to avoid HDF5 overhead in MAT-file
- %OPTION% to include a variable greater that 2GB
- %OPTION% to use compression by default

#### Q65. Which choice cannot add a directory to the search path?

- %OPTION% the **path** function
- %OPTION% the **savepath** function
- %OPTION% using **Set Path** in the **Environment** menu
- %OPTION% the **addpath** function

[Reference](https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/savepath.html)

#### Q66. Which is not a function to plot three-dimensional data?

- %OPTION% mesh
- %OPTION% surf
- %OPTION% contour
- %OPTION% grid

[Reference](https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/grid.html)

#### Q67. What is the reason to save a MAT-file using the v-7.3 flag?

- %OPTION% to use compression by default
- %OPTION% to ensure backward compatibility
- %OPTION% to include a variable greater than 2GB
- %OPTION% to avoid HDF5 overhead in MAT-file

[Reference](https://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/169755-saving-variable-with-v7-3-flag-check)

#### Q68. This graph could be the result of which block of code?

![MatLab Q41](images/matlab_Q41.png?raw=png)

- %OPTION% `a = randn(1,1000); histogram(a) ylabel('counts')`
- %OPTION% `a = rand(1,1000); histogram(a) ylabel('counts')`
- %OPTION% `a = randi(1,1000); histogram(a) ylabel('counts')`
- %OPTION% `a = rng(1,1000); histogram(a) ylabel('counts')`

#### Q69. What is a key difference between && and &?

- %OPTION% && is a logical operator and & is not.
- %OPTION% && is always slower than &
- %OPTION% && employs short-circuiting behavior and & does not.
- %OPTION% && is a bitwise operator and & is not.

[Reference](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1379415/whats-the-difference-between-and-in-matlab)

#### Q70. What is the result of this code?

```
s="abcd"; s(3)='x'
```

- %OPTION% "abxd"
- %OPTION% abxd
- %OPTION% a 1x 3 string array
- %OPTION% a run-time error

#### Q71. In which case would you use varargin in a function you write?

- %OPTION% You want to count the number of input arguments.
- %OPTION% You want to include optional input arguments.
- %OPTION% You want the workspace variable names of the input arguments.
- %OPTION% You want the data types of the input arguments.

en.TITLE: Skill Assessments Quizzes
en.DESC:
Collection of questions and answers on different subjects aimed to help
you test your knowledge before an important job interview!

Data from __data__. UI by __bandinopla__

es.TITLE: Questionarios de evaluación de habilidades
es.DESC:
Colección de preguntas y respuestas sobre diferentes temas orientadas a
ayudarte a testear tu conocimiento antes de una importante entrevista de trabajo! 

Datos de __data__. UI por __bandinopla__
